intro: Polygala jefensis, commonly known as the Jefén polygala, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
